name: Volatile Market
description: The greatest entrepreneurial minds of the past and present are ready to combine their knowledge to shake the galactic economy like never before! But the galaxy may not be ready to handle so many financial puppetmasters in play at one time.
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Specialist Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Dominion, Ferengi Alliance, and Ferengi Traditionalist Faction Missions are available during the faction phase. Open the Event to access them.
-- In a Specialist Event, you will select crew to engage in Specialist Missions.
-- Only a single crew with corresponding skills can be assigned to a Specialist Mission. After the mission is complete, that crew will be disabled from doing Specialist Missions for some period of time.
-- Specialist Missions take time to complete. The higher selected crew skills are the less time it will take them to complete a mission.
-- Only the highest skill of a crew is considered when calculating time to complete a mission.
-- Using crew with matching Specialist Mission bonus traits will significantly decrease time needed to complete a mission.
-- Each time a Specialist Mission is completed, some progress is also gained on the Main Mission. Completing the Main Mission rewards substantial amounts of Event Victory Points.
-- When you fail to gain bonus progress on the Main Mission using featured crew or crew with matching event bonus traits, the bonus progress chance goes up slightly the next time you use such crew in a mission. If you score the bonus progress, the bonus chance amount goes back to its initial value. 
-- Using any version of Hanok, L'Kar, Pel, or Merchants will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Specialist Missions.
-- Every Faction or Specialist Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Hanok, L'Kar, Pel, or Merchants
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: William
featured_crew.flavor: Rescuing yet another Harry Kim further drains any excitement for this multiverse mission that William had.

action.name: That's All The Multiverse Is! Just Lazy Derivative Remixes!

featured_crew.name: L'Kar
featured_crew.flavor: L’Kar served as a sorter on the Cosmia’s ship, and later joined the D’Vana Tendi’s pirate ship.

action.name: I Would Rather Die Than Return To My Childhood Dungeon!

featured_crew.name: Pel
featured_crew.flavor: Pel disguised herself as a male and displayed great business acumen to fight the notion that females can't earn profit.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Nog
rewards.flavor: Nog became the first Ferengi member of Starfleet, and was assigned to DS9 as part of his cadet field studies.

rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: William
rewards.flavor: Rescuing yet another Harry Kim further drains any excitement for this multiverse mission that William had.

action.name: That's All The Multiverse Is! Just Lazy Derivative Remixes!

rewards.name: Pel

rewards.name: Pel
rewards.flavor: Pel disguised herself as a male and displayed great business acumen to fight the notion that females can't earn profit.

rewards.name: L'Kar
rewards.flavor: L’Kar served as a sorter on the Cosmia’s ship, and later joined the D’Vana Tendi’s pirate ship.

action.name: I Would Rather Die Than Return To My Childhood Dungeon!

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "And that's why I said we shouldn't let these guys from the future take over! This is our gala--well hello there, Captain! Just the Federation sap--I mean, sage, I wanted to see."
"This is your ace in the hole? A Starfleet captain? The people who have 'cast aside the acquisition of wealth'! How could anyone so naive help us with an economic problem of this scale?!"

"Having someone with a different perspective is exactly what we need right now! Captain, the temporal anomaly crisis has led people from different times and universes to throw their proverbial weight around. It might not seem like anything new, as long as the crisis has gone on."

"But we've already seen instances of people using future knowledge to play the market or racing to new mining locations that wouldn't normally be discovered for centuries. It's throwing more than just the economy off. Think you could help us?"
